title: Staff Software Engineer - Community Support Platform
content:
Airbnb was born in 2007 when two Hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 4 million Hosts who have welcomed more than 1 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, Hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.Staff Software Engineer - Community Support Platform:
Airbnb was born in 2007 when two Hosts welcomed three guests to their San Francisco home, and has since grown to over 4 million Hosts who have welcomed more than 1 billion guest arrivals in almost every country across the globe. Every day, Hosts offer unique stays and experiences that make it possible for guests to connect with communities in a more authentic way.
The Community You will Join:
Airbnb Community support platform team takes care of any host and guest issues at any stage of their booking. We are building a world-class community support platform that resolves guest and host problems very efficiently. We build and maintain our own in-house global community support platform because no solution exists with the global reach needed. 
Airbnbâ€™s business grows rapidly year over year, and so does Airbnb Community support volume. We value our guest and host privacy, that's why we have a very robust role based access control system. Ambassadors have very limited and controlled access in our system. As a Staff Engineer for Provisioning, CSP, this individual would be leading the solution to have a very flexible and controlled provisioning mechanism on the provisioning platform.
The difference you will make:
We are looking for a self-motivated leader who is interested in working in a highly dynamic environment by collaborating with cross-functional and cross-geographical teams. As a Staff Engineer, you would be expected to bring in expertise of managing large scale platforms, and bringing predictive tools & processes to improve the availability of our Provisioning platform for all our internal & external stakeholders. Our Provisioning platform connects with multiple internal systems and has grown in complexity & reach. We are looking for a leader who can understand the provisioning space and architect the new provisioning platform, one that is able to understand and analyze the current system challenges & build a simple design of this complex space. The current system needs intelligent alerting systems, a focus on building reliable observability instrumentation and processes for our engineers to consistently uplevel the availability and performance of their services. This is a strategic role where you will be responsible for building and scaling a high-performing team, developing and optimizing provisioning processes, and ensuring a seamless provisioning experience for our internal stakeholders.
A Typical Day:
Develop and re-architect the provisioning system for internal and external stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional stakeholders to define the scope and responsibilities of the provisioning team.
Hire, onboard, and mentor a team of engineers with diverse skill sets to meet the provisioning team's objectives.
Design and implement robust provisioning processes and workflows that align with the company's goals and industry best practices.
Establish and maintain a strong provisioning infrastructure with the necessary tools, systems, and technologies.
Collaborate with other engineering teams to ensure seamless integration of provisioning systems and processes.
Continuously monitor and improve provisioning performance, identifying areas for optimization and automation.
Stay updated with the latest industry trends and technologies related to provisioning and implement relevant improvements
Your expertise:
Minimum of 12+ years of experience in relevant industry experience in a fast paced tech environment
Strong expertise in provisioning technologies, tools, and systems.
Proven experience in building and leading high-performing engineering teams.
Deep understanding of provisioning processes, workflows, and best practices.
Solid knowledge of scalable infrastructure design and implementation.
Experience with cloud platforms (e.g., AWS, GCP) and containerization technologies (e.g., Docker, Kubernetes).
Strong working knowledge across observability tools (eg. DataDog, Open Telemetry etc.)
Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills with a data-driven approach.
Strong communication and collaboration skills to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Technical leadership: hands on experience leading project teams and setting technical direction and strategy
You are passionate about efficiency, availability, technical quality and system quality.
Our commitment to inclusion & belonging:
Airbnb is committed to working with the broadest talent pool possible. We believe diverse ideas foster innovation and engagement, and allow us to attract creatively-led people, and to develop the best products, services and solutions. All qualified individuals are encouraged to apply.
If you need assistance, or a reasonable accommodation during the application and recruiting process, please contact us at: reasonableaccommodations@airbnb.com.

I acknowledge that I am applying for employment with Airbnb Global Capability Center Private Limited (the “Company”), and I hereby consent to the Company collecting, processing, storing and using my personal information including any sensitive personal data or information, for the following purposes:
To contact and communicate with me in connection with my application;
To discuss and evaluate my application;
To conduct any background checks or similar activities; and
To conduct, or to comply with any lawful order or request made in connection with, any investigation or proceeding, or to otherwise deal with any grievance, by, against or otherwise involving me.

I also consent to the Company and its affiliated entities:
In conjunction with the above, disclosing or transferring any part or all of my personal information including any sensitive personal data or information, to any of its affiliated entities and/or to any of the Company’s or its affiliated entities’ vendors or service providers, and to transfer or store the same to or in any part of the world;
Storing or retaining any or all of my personal information including any sensitive personal data or information, for such period as it may determine to be appropriate, including for audit or compliance purposes anywhere in the world;
Disclosing and using any or all of my personal information including any sensitive personal data or information, where reasonably required or deemed appropriate by the Company for purposes of evaluating my application; and
Permitting or authorizing any of its affiliated entities to do any of the things that the Company is permitted to do under this document.
In this document, “my personal information” includes but is not limited to my name; gender; address; or passport number; birth date; blood type; photograph(s); contact information such as telephone number(s) and email address(es); family information; educational, professional and employment history, records, certifications and information; information on memberships in organizations; health and disability information; bank account and other payment information; criminal history and records, if any; and performance information.
